meanings.definition: A unit of electric charge equal to the charge carried by one mole of electrons.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that faradays measure electric charge.
meanings.sent2: The scientist calculated the faradays to determine the amount of charge in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The faradays were having a party, and each electron was invited!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a faraday, spreading through the room with electric energy.
meanings.sent5: The concept of faradays lit up my understanding of electricity like a bright bulb.

meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic flux equal to one hundred million (10^8) lines of magnetic flux.
meanings.sent1: The magnetic field was measured in faradays to determine its strength.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle moved in response to the faradays present in the area.
meanings.sent3: The faradays in the magnet were feeling attractive today!
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like a faraday, pulling him towards her with magnetic force.
meanings.sent5: The image of the magnetic field was as clear as a picture when measured in faradays.
